NewWords.WordPhrase: have developed or become very successful 进展，进步
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He has come a long way since the days he could afford only a meal a day.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 一年一年（一天一天，一星期一星期）地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Work becomes harder with each passing day.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. undertake to be legally responsible for 保证；担保
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Many shopkeepers guarantee satisfaction to customers.

NewWords.WordPhrase: occur as a result of 因……而发生，是……的结果
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The problem resulted from past errors.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  thing one has promised to do 承诺；保证
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He made a commitment to pay off all his debts.

NewWords.WordPhrase: while (sth.) is happening or being done 在……之中；正当……时候
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Someone shouted in the midst of his speech.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. return to a normal state 复原；恢复，复苏
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She made a quick recovery after her illness.

NewWords.WordPhrase: against this background; under such circumstances 在这种背景下，在这种情况下
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We are making reforms, and we must decide our policy in this context.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. be successful, very active, or widespread; prosper 茂盛，繁荣；兴旺
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The crops flourished in the rich bottomland.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. correct, change or improve (sth. undesirable) 纠正；消除（弊病等）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. How can we remedy the situation?

NewWords.WordPhrase: cause to experience or undergo 使经历，使遭受
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They were subjected to great suffering.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. treat (one person or group) worse than others 歧视
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This new law discriminates against lower-paid colored workers.

NewWords.WordPhrase: try to make (sth.) appear more important than it is 大肆宣扬；鼓吹
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He played up his opponent's weak point so much.

NewWords.WordPhrase: taking the most hopeful view; at most 最乐观地看；充其量
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. At best a few hundred people attended the opening ceremony.

NewWords.WordPhrase: prep. different from; not like 与……不同，不像
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She was unlike him in every way except for her coal-black eyes.
e.g. Foreign investors would do well to take a look at China's developing economy.
e.g. The sick man's condition is grave.
